list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: the sharing or exchanging of intimate thoughts and feelings, especially when the exchange is on a mental or spiritual level.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: in this churchyard communion with the dead was almost palpable
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Trong sự hiệp thông nhà thờ này với người chết gần như sờ thấy

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: the service of Christian worship at which bread and wine are consecrated and shared.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: Communion was celebrated once a month
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Sự hiệp thông đã được tổ chức một lần một tháng một lần

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a relationship of recognition and acceptance between Christian churches or denominations, or between individual Christians or Christian communities and a church (signified by a willingness to give or receive the Eucharist).
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the Eastern Churches are not in communion with Rome
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Các nhà thờ phương Đông không hiệp thông với Rome
